name: jhunt
text: Ray and I feel the same way about computers.  Nobody even cares about LOGO anymore.

name: jrpigman
text: The turtle just sits there and he is totally glarin' at you.

name: overmedicated
text: What was that shit even FOR

name: farqussus
text: It was created by the 'If' Appreciation Society in an effort to entrench in the minds of a new generation the permutations of their favourite word.

name: cracklewater
text:
Worked for me! My first taste of computer Operating came from directing Apple's logo turtle to make repeating spiral patterns.
Now I am the raddest hax0r.

A few years late, we were all disturbed by the clunky, turtle-shaped turtle that was the star of Atari's logo extravaganza.

As an aside, that same Atari became a platform for an early computer censorship debate, when someone wrote 'wank' on the screen, confusing the turtle and casing the teachers to keep us all inside while we waited for the defiler to admit their deed.

Naughty Manish...

name: lucid
text:
Man I totally remember doing huge animations on LOGO. Making the turtle buzz around appearing as various pixellated sprites and stamping copies everywhere.

I made an animation of a helicopter exploding and its rotorblade hitting a guy and splitting him in half. Then a closing shot on a pair of gravestones, one for each half of his body.

name: soticoto
text:
You just gave me wood.
It aches.
So will your head when you read that.

name: centipede_damascus
text: I love Ray's apprehension about Photoshop.

name: jdhenry105
text: Yep, Lyle will keep an eye out for it.

name: molesticide
text:
"i'll watch out for that" "i'll look into that" "i need to go check that out!"

things you say when you don't actually care.

name: delzhand
text: Photoshop is pretty decent.

name: closefriend
text: I like Gimp, although it's not really the best program for people who don't like bugs.

name: goosey
text:
It also has some pretty appalling interface design decisions which interrupt a good workflow model.

I'm a Usability Engineer! It is too a real job!

But in terms of how much power you get for free it's awesome.

name: stuart
text: Paint.NET totally rules. But this is the absolute wrong place for such a discussion.

name: howard
text: Agreed. And agreed.

name: undyingsong
text: No, it really is the right place for such a conversation.

name: slalvation
text: But it's pretty awesome if you don't pay for it.

name: syrupykeyboard
text: You wouldn't pay your girlfriend for AIDS, would you? Do you think that it is rad to have AIDS slalvation

name: ssddr
text: Ray's arms looks bizzare in the last pannel.

name: rowboat
text: I miss the knobby little arms.

name: deancain29
text: Ray is saying what we're all thinking, yeah?

name: tetrisattack
text: I, for one, would never laugh at you Ray.

name: 1000hz
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: honesttom
text: Ha ha ha! Ha ha ha ha ha ha! Haaaaa-ha ha ha ha ha! Ah-ha-ha-ha! Oh, mercy. Ha ha.

name: overmedicated
text: Apparently, they're all laughing at you. Not me. i respect you as a personal computer user.

name: steerpike66
text: I am going to ruin the perfection of your 100 chubbies. With a chubby.

name: miaou
text: I be damn preempted on that one...

name: quarantine
text: Lyle's suspenders!

name: hypoluxa
text:
"Is that a pretty bad program????"
Hilarious.

name: farqussus
text:
Not only did you quote the strip, you included excess question marks in said quote.

You are violating the law and definition of QUOTATION MARKS

name: windfish
text: Nobody in new programming classes cares about my story about how I used to plant a .com file on DOS-run computers in programming lab that would clear the screen and print HELLO CHARLES in huge letters when they typed in "a:"

name: cracklewater
text:
I once knew a POKE that would make it impossible to stop a PRINT/GOTO loop. On a Commodore 64.

The NSA was on my trail for a while.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
My stepson used to go to Walmarts with a virus infected floppy and krunk their display computers.

Now he is in Walmart management. They must have secretly infected him while he thought he was infecting their display units.

Funny how those things work....

name: catjumpjohn
text: I love it when Ray doesn't understand computers.

name: mikeronomicon
text: Ah, the days of programming in basic. I miss you my sweet Apple II E.

name: homepie
text:
10 PRINT "RAY SMUCKLES"
20 GOTO 10
RUN

name: link
text:
66000th view? That probably doesn't count for anything.

I remember being incredibly young and showing everyone all my screensavers one by one and everything I could do with them. And everyone pretended to be impressed.
